result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trenon D. DENFELD

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: All records scanned and verified.

Defendant in custody.
State moves to dismiss and read in all counts. The defendant plead to charges in 14 CF 525, 14 CF 526, 15 CF 1, 15 CF 2, 15 CF 3, 15 CF 162, 15 CF 163 and 15 CF 118.  Motion granted.
Minutes.
Letter from Atty. Pangburn to JLF outlincing plea agreement.
Plea hearing set for 06-12-15 @ 9:30 a.m. BR-3.
Status conference set for 05-28-15 @ 2:00 p.m. BR-1
$500.00 cash bail returned to Todd Ward by check instruction No. CR 46.

Order Returning Bail 
The court orders that the $500.00 cash bail posted by Mr. Todd Ward be returned to him forthwith, and, as a result, the defendant, or someone on his behalf, shall post $500.00 cash bond on his behalf in order to be released on this case.
Second Amended Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail issued.  Copy filed.

Defendant in custody.  
Tom Ward the individual that posted the cash bail has requested the return of his money.   Counsel comment.  Court believes it would be appropriate to return the cash bond and will so order.   
Minutes.

from Todd Ward to Judge Rohrer, dated 03-24-15.
RE: Return of Cash Bond money.
w/copy of bond and envelope.

from Judge Rohrer to Counsel of defendant, dated 3-26-15.
RE: letter received from defendant.

Letter from Atty. Gail Prost to Judge Rohrer, dated 03-30-15.
RE: Bond Hearing
Motion Hearing scheduled for 04-06-15 @ 3:30 p.m. BR-1.

ADDRESS INFO for Trenon D. DENFELD
Current: 1814 28th Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States  (Effective: 02-18-2015)
Prior: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States

$500.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.  
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond.
Plea date is set for 05-01-15 at 3:30 p.m.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 02-06-15 at 2:30 p.m.
BAIL MOTION - 
The parties argue the motion.
The Court amends the cash bail to $500.00 with the following conditions:
 - defendant is to attend school fulltime;
- defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety;
- defendant is to have a 10:00 p.m. curfew imposed.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Information.
Amended Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail issued.  Copy delivered to jail.  Copy filed.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 01-14-15 at 2:00 p.m.   
Minutes.
Melinda Alfredson through Public Defender
RE:  Bail jumping, on 12-26-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 01-05-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 cash.  Cash bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. 
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
